content:
Manage your webhook - Developer
Skip to content
Managing your webhook
Â¶
Your webhook should now be processing metadata events in real-time.
Reviewing metrics
Â¶
You can monitor the activity through the
Monitor
tab of your function:
Open the
AWS Lambda functions console
.
From the list of
Functions
, click your function.
Change to the
Monitor
tab.
Here you can see basic graphs of metrics from CloudWatch.
Reviewing logs
Â¶
You can review logs of individual requests through CloudWatch logs:
Open the
AWS Lambda functions console
.
From the list of
Functions
, click your function.
Change to the
Monitor
tab.
Click the
View CloudWatch logs
button.
Under the
Log streams
tab, in the
Log streams
table you will see all the logs created by events. You can click on any log stream in the table to view the detailed messages logged during event processing.
Updating the SDK
Â¶
Because we used layers, you can easily update the SDK for your function by updating the layer:
Open the
AWS Lambda layers console
.
From the list of
Layers
, click your layer containing the SDK you want to update.
In the upper-right, click the
Create version
button.
Click the
Upload

Open the
AWS Lambda layers console
.
From the list of
Layers
, click your layer containing the SDK you want to update.
In the upper-right, click the
Create version
button.
Click the
Upload
button to select the lambda-layer file for the SDK.
For
Compatible architectures
select
x86_64
.
For
Compatible runtimes
select the latest version of the target language.
In the lower-right, click the
Create
button.
Open the
AWS Lambda functions console
.
On the
Code
tab, scroll down to
Layers
.
In the upper-right of the
Layers
table, click the
Edit
button.
From the
Layers
table, select the latest version of the layer you created under
Layer version
.
In the lower-right, click the
Save
button.
Updating your code
Â¶
To modify your own code:
Open the
AWS Lambda functions console
.
From the
Functions
list, click the function you want to deploy your code into.
On the
Code
tab:
Java
Python
In the upper-right of the
Code source
table, click
Upload from
and then
.zip or .jar file
.
Use the
Upload
button to select the zip file containing your code.
In the lower-right of the dialog click the
Save
button to deploy your new code.
In the
Code source
table you can either:

.
Use the
Upload
button to select the zip file containing your code.
In the lower-right of the dialog click the
Save
button to deploy your new code.
In the
Code source
table you can either:
(Recommended) Copy / paste the code from your new module (file) into the editor window for
lambda_function.py
.
In the upper-right, click
Upload from
and choose the location of your code.
Towards the middle of the
Code source
table, click the
Deploy
button to deploy your code.
